text:
BINOD CHAUDHARY: Actually, after
I participated in the business,

I think there was a sea
change in our whole thinking.

You know, I stopped
the textile business.

Instead of bringing in
textile, which my father used

to do from Japan and Korea, I
brought the first Suzuki car

to Nepal even before Suzuki
was produced in India.
Maruti came much later.
And then there is--

I think in hindsight,
when I think

of it, or having brought
National Panasonic to Nepal
to assemble a radio--

two-band radio, we used to
call it two-band radios,
with the antenna.

Forget about today's world,
the kids of this generation

can't even think
about it, can't even

imagine what we
are talking about.

I mean, those were things
which were probably

much ahead of its time,
initiatives much ahead of time,
but it worked.

I think I saw an
opportunity which was new.

I knew that it was
going to be challenging,

but I also knew that it's going
to put me to a different level.

It's going to open a
completely new dimension here.

Otherwise, I would be competing
with a hundred other textile

importers and still
sitting in that shop.
